commit_message:
Redundancy-module-of-VNFFG

This specification describes changes needed to support optional module t
o construct one more VNFFG by selecting redundancy VNFFG module.

Co-authored-By: Hosung Baek <sungbogo28@gmail.com>
Blueprint:Redundancy-module-of-VNFFG

Change-Id: I68de28093e8cdd828eaf2c1295e1dd8213e1208b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker-specs refs/changes/67/685867/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [Redundancy module for VNFFG] Problem description Currently, only one forwarding path is allowed per VNFFGD. Therefore, Tacker can not support multi-path for VNFFG. Besides, Tacker does not configure backup path for VNFFG. If VNF instance in VNFFG is failed, it recovers withVNFFG healing for VNFFG scaling. However, it causes more time to recover comparing with pre-configured backup path. Proposed change We sill provide the configuration of redundant VNFFGs using one VNFFGD as an option for redundancy moduel. Two VNFFGs are created if redundancy option is selected. The procedure of configuration is as follows. First VNFFG is created as current way. Second VNFFG is created to maximally disjoint as much as possible with the vnf instances selected in the first VNFFG. For the future use, redundancy module can be used for multi-path routing or backup path for VNFFG. The method we are going to implement is as follows. We will modify the tacker-client code to add the redundancy module option. After that, we will modify ~code to repeat the get_vnf_mapping process to create redundant VNFFG. In the process of creating the second VNFFG, wei will add a procedure to avoid selecting the vnf instance previsouly selected. Assignee Ho-sung Baek (sungbogo28@gmail.com, gh1emd@korea.ac.kr) Yun-young Cho (yunyoung0309@gmail.com, yunyoung0309@korea.ac.kr)

commit_message:
delete bash_completion in subcommand

There are two "completion" in the subcommand table: bash-completion
and bash_completion. but "bash_completion" is useless, so delete
it and extra code.
Closes-Bug: #1670123

Change-Id: If7a654102fc05be893bc789be0543fd2cd9634bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient refs/changes/75/441675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix paging link protocol when behind haproxy

When using the designate public endpoint through haproxy, designate
is returning a paging link with the incorrect protocol.  This change
is to make sure designate configurs oslo_middleware to parse the
X-Forwarded-Proto header set by haproxy.

Change-Id: Ia3288ccfc655a2814c36204a5cb381d3aa57e53e
Closes-Bug: #1713663
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_designate refs/changes/90/706090/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
use include_tasks instead of include

include is marked as deprecated since ansible 2.4[0]

Switch to include_tasks or import_playbook as necessary

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_module.html#deprecated

Change-Id: Iff06f10c34d7d9729841d925010c5d3015dbc91a

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-hypervisors policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-hypervisors API policies.
This policy is default to SYSTEM_READER role.

Policy rules are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I2757498e0271f9b4bd90ee6bbaa444dc914e84c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/03/716003/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.policies import base as base_policy # Check that system scoped admin, member and reader are able to # perform operations on hypervisors. # NOTE(gmann): Until old default rule which is admin_api is # deprecated and not removed, project admin and legacy admin # will be able to read the agent data. This make sure that existing # tokens will keep working even we have changed this policy defaults # to reader role. self.reader_authorized_contexts = [ self.system_admin_context, self.system_member_context, self.system_reader_context, self.legacy_admin_context, # Check that non-system-reader are not able to perform operations # on hypervisors self.reader_unauthorized_contexts = [ self.system_foo_context, self.other_project_member_context, self.project_foo_context, self.project_member_context, self.project_reader_context] rule_name = hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'list' self.common_policy_check(self.reader_authorized_contexts, self.reader_unauthorized_contexts, rule_name = hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'list-detail' self.common_policy_check(self.reader_authorized_contexts, self.reader_unauthorized_contexts, rule_name = hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'show' self.common_policy_check(self.reader_authorized_contexts, self.reader_unauthorized_contexts, rule_name = hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'uptime' self.common_policy_check(self.reader_authorized_contexts, self.reader_unauthorized_contexts, rule_name = hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'search' self.common_policy_check(self.reader_authorized_contexts, self.reader_unauthorized_contexts, rule_name = hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'servers' self.common_policy_check(self.reader_authorized_contexts, self.reader_unauthorized_contexts, rule_name = hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'statistics' self.common_policy_check(self.reader_authorized_contexts, self.reader_unauthorized_contexts, # Check that system reader is able to perform operations self.reader_authorized_contexts = [ self.system_admin_context, self.system_member_context, self.system_reader_context] # Check that non-system-reader is not able to perform operations self.reader_unauthorized_contexts = [ self.legacy_admin_context, self.project_admin_context, class HypervisorsNoLegacyPolicyTest(HypervisorsScopeTypePolicyTest): """Test Hypervisors APIs policies with system scope enabled, and no more deprecated rules. """ without_deprecated_rules = True rules_without_deprecation = { hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'list': base_policy.SYSTEM_READER, hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'list-detail': base_policy.SYSTEM_READER, hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'show': base_policy.SYSTEM_READER, hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'statistics': base_policy.SYSTEM_READER, hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'uptime': base_policy.SYSTEM_READER, hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'search': base_policy.SYSTEM_READER, hv_policies.BASE_POLICY_NAME % 'servers': base_policy.SYSTEM_READER, }

commit_message:
Respect SSL devstack configuration

If devstack is spawned with SSL, that means we need
to configure OVN databases connectors to use TLS.

Change-Id: I4f95a6ea0f299700281e3dde26ebcaba77a1b1fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider refs/changes/87/715387/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # How to connect to ovsdb-server hosting the OVN NB database if is_service_enabled tls-proxy; then OVN_PROTO=ssl else OVN_PROTO=tcp fi OVN_NB_REMOTE=${OVN_NB_REMOTE:-$OVN_PROTO:$SERVICE_HOST:6641} iniset ${OCTAVIA_CONF} ovn ovn_nb_connection "$OVN_NB_REMOTE" if is_service_enabled tls-proxy; then iniset ${OCTAVIA_CONF} ovn ovn_nb_connection "$OVN_NB_REMOTE" iniset ${OCTAVIA_CONF} ovn ovn_nb_ca_cert "$INT_CA_DIR/ca-chain.pem" iniset ${OCTAVIA_CONF} ovn ovn_nb_certificate "$INT_CA_DIR/$DEVSTACK_CERT_NAME.crt" iniset ${OCTAVIA_CONF} ovn ovn_nb_private_key "$INT_CA_DIR/private/$DEVSTACK_CERT_NAME.key" fi

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 3.0.0

The new version enables a lot of standard flake8 checks, so a few
fixes are required. W503 is disabled as it conflicts with W504
and the latter seems to be preferred nowadays.

Change-Id: I9834e1f2a31cee840c3260aaddfabd3331a86ba7

commit_message:
Check LCStatus instead of MessageID to determine if an iDRAC is ready

We are currently checking the MessageID to determine if an iDRAC
is ready. This patch is to check the value of LCStatus instead of
MessageID. If the value of LCStatus is "0", then the iDRAC is
considered ready.

Change-Id: I3426c226c4bb3cdcc95b98e9b203f100bb6777d5
(cherry picked from commit bcce3bdc6b33c8d6f0721eac024ebff61de1e2db)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-dracclient refs/changes/65/715165/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IDRAC_IS_READY = "0" lc_status = utils.find_xml(result, 'LCStatus', uris.DCIM_LCService).text return lc_status == IDRAC_IS_READY
deleted_lines: IDRAC_IS_READY = "LC061" message_id = utils.find_xml(result, 'MessageID', uris.DCIM_LCService).text return message_id == IDRAC_IS_READY

commit_message:
Check LCStatus instead of MessageID to determine if an iDRAC is ready

We are currently checking the MessageID to determine if an iDRAC
is ready. This patch is to check the value of LCStatus instead of
MessageID. If the value of LCStatus is "0", then the iDRAC is
considered ready.

Change-Id: I3426c226c4bb3cdcc95b98e9b203f100bb6777d5
(cherry picked from commit bcce3bdc6b33c8d6f0721eac024ebff61de1e2db)

platform from working.

commit_message:
Remove tempest_tempest_conf_overrides from featureset 52

As described in related bug these values are dropped when the
same is defined via featureset override on the job. We should
drop them from the featureset to avoid confusion. They will
be set as defaults in tempestconf

Change-Id: I5aec865389be13ec2a42a1cbc72b9e7e30a4805f
Related-Bug: 1868938

deleted_lines: # Copyright 2017 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import glob import logging import shutil import tempfile import six from mistral_lib import actions from tripleo_common.utils.safe_import import Repo LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class GitCloneAction(actions.Action): """Clones a remote git repository :param container: name of the container associated with the plan :param url: url of git repository :return: returns local path of cloned git repository """ def __init__(self, container, url): super(GitCloneAction, self).__init__() self.container = container self.url = url def _checkout_reference(self, repo, ref): return repo.git.checkout(repo.refs[ref]) def run(self, context): # make a temp directory to contain the repo local_dir_path = tempfile.mkdtemp( suffix="_%s_import" % self.container) url_bits = self.url.rsplit('@') err_msg = None try: # create a bare repo repo = Repo.clone_from(url_bits[0], local_dir_path) except Exception: err_msg = ("Error cloning remote repository: %s " % url_bits[0]) LOG.exception(err_msg) return actions.Result(error=err_msg) # if a tag value was given, checkout that tag if len(url_bits) > 1: try: self._checkout_reference(repo, url_bits[-1]) except IndexError: err_msg = ("Error finding %s reference " "from remote repository" % url_bits[-1]) LOG.exception(err_msg) except Exception: err_msg = ("Error checking out %s reference from remote " "repository %s" % (url_bits[-1], url_bits[0])) LOG.exception(err_msg) if err_msg: return actions.Result(error=err_msg) return local_dir_path class GitCleanupAction(actions.Action): """Removes temporary files associated with GitCloneAction operations :param container: name of the container associated with the plan :return: None if successful. Returns error on failure to delete associated temporary files """ def __init__(self, container): self.container = container def run(self, context): try: temp_dir = tempfile.gettempdir() target_path = '%s/*_%s_import' % (temp_dir, self.container) path = glob.glob(target_path)[0] shutil.rmtree(path) except IndexError as idx_err: LOG.exception("Directory not found: %s" % target_path) return actions.Result(error=six.text_type(idx_err)) except OSError as os_err: LOG.exception("Error removing directory: %s" % target_path) return actions.Result(error=six.text_type(os_err))

deleted_lines: def _store_passwords_in_mistral_env(mistral): """Store required passwords in a mistral environment""" env_name = 'tripleo.undercloud-config' config_data = { 'undercloud_ceilometer_snmpd_password': CONF['snmp_readonly_user_password'], 'undercloud_db_password': CONF['undercloud_db_password'], 'undercloud_db_host': CONF['undercloud_db_host'] } try: mistral.environments.get(env_name).variables mistral.environments.update( name=env_name, description='Undercloud configuration parameters', variables=json.dumps(config_data, sort_keys=True)) except (ks_exceptions.NotFound, mistralclient_exc.APIException): # The environment is not created, we need to create it mistral.environments.create( name=env_name, description='Undercloud configuration parameters', variables=json.dumps(config_data, sort_keys=True)) print('INFO: Undercloud post - Mistral environment configured ' 'successfully.') def _prepare_ssh_environment(mistral): mistral.executions.create('tripleo.validations.v1.copy_ssh_key') def _create_default_plan(mistral): plan_exists = [True for c in sdk.list_containers() if c['name'] == 'overcloud'] if not plan_exists and os.path.isdir(THT_DIR): mistral.executions.create( 'tripleo.plan_management.v1.create_deployment_plan', workflow_input={'container': 'overcloud', 'use_default_templates': True}) print('INFO: Undercloud post - Default plan overcloud created.') tripleo_validations_enabled = 'true' in _run_command( ['hiera', 'tripleo_validations_enabled']).lower() _store_passwords_in_mistral_env(mistral) _create_default_plan(mistral) if tripleo_validations_enabled: _prepare_ssh_environment(mistral) print("INFO: Undercloud post - " "SSH Keys for TripleO Validations deployed.")

commit_message:
Introduce CephAnsibleLimit

Allow the existing ceph_ansible_limit variable in tripleo-ansible
to be overridden through TripleO Heat Templates. This is useful
for speeding up stack updates to scale compute nodes.

Change-Id: I506ec233793615f94389056c56274ce53e04361f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/96/704396/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CephAnsibleLimit: type: string default: '' default: When ceph-ansible is executed this string will be passed to the the ansible-playbook --limit option. E.g., if CephAnsibleLimit was set to clients, then ceph-ansible would not change any hosts in the inventory group clients. ceph_ansible_limit: {get_param: CephAnsibleLimit}

commit_message:
Expect python3 client package in CentOS8

In CentOS, we expect to have python3 client package in 8.x while we
expect to have python2 in 7.x .
Fix unit tests to expect the correct version according to os major
version.

Change-Id: Ifdc8e09197f15720d585598b54ba9427f436dc3a

commit_message:
Cleanup hieradata for unused services in undercloud.

We currently don't support congress and tacker in TripleO, so we can
remove the hieradata for these services.
Also, we don't expect to have Barbican, Horizon, Manila and Sahara
in undercloud, so can remove hieradata for these services from
undercloud hieradata.

Change-Id: I3ec65ad41d6b37bd0f01ac62d4158248556c84af

commit_message:
Ensure no attempt to deleted sg rules owned by Octavia happens

When updating the LB security group with only the rules applied
on a Network Policy we are also considering the sg rules owned by
octavia, this result on failure when trying to delete the rules
as this operation is not allowed.

This commit ensures only the rules owned by the correct tenant
are deleted.

Change-Id: I06ece3fd93d1408f6023d3daf0ba152fe7dfe4e4
Closes-bug: 1869063

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-instance-usage-audit-log

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-instance-usage-audit-log API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I070cedee068f87a8d466d38d34abcad552ecd015

commit_message:
Fix pre-commit execution

- assures pre-commit *fully* runs on CI
- fixes broken newlines caused by incomplete CI execution
- bumps ansible-lint to newer version that can finally auto-detect
  playbooks and roles
- moves ansible-lint config in official location to allow it to loaded
  regardless how is called
- cleans tox.ini and normalize indentation of multi-line options
- avoid installing non linting requirements for linter environment
- runs doc8 as a pre-commit hook and updates it config so developer can
  even run it directly. tox.ini is no longer the right place to keep
  tool configs, being replaced by multi-purpose setup.cfg which also
  avoids cluttering root with config items from each tool.

Change-Id: Ib99c8f3ad5f49ebe797de1509c042627cbff29a0
Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1852213

commit_message:
Replace python-charm-jobs to py3 job

python-charm-jobs is py2.7 template which needs
to be replaced by py3. Replacing that with
py35 job and they can move to most recent py3
version once they are ready.

Change-Id: I5269fe2a0f6c5d3a2310b4ade41050e15848615f

commit_message:
Enable centos-8 testing for role-addition

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/702144/
Change-Id: Ie02735566304ad3d4acdd705851349998ff2912c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Switch to unittest.mock from mock

In python3 mock is in the unittest package and doesn't need to
install mock directly.

Change-Id: I195ac9739936372042b5d7d3c0c3f3bd82b04107

subject: Add test coverage of existing instance usage log policies
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-25 21:54:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/policies/test_instance_usage_audit_log.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_instance_usage_audit_log.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fda60b873f27b6d3d5bf12435f71f3787d7fbedb', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing instance usage log policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing instance usage audit
log policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I4a8b935829edb1d7fd7efb0291d71d3a9d2b7abd
'}]
commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing instance usage log policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing instance usage audit
log policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I4a8b935829edb1d7fd7efb0291d71d3a9d2b7abd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/715080/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from nova import exception class InstanceUsageAuditPolicyEnforcementV21(test.NoDBTestCase): def setUp(self): super(InstanceUsageAuditPolicyEnforcementV21, self).setUp() self.controller = v21_ial.InstanceUsageAuditLogController() self.req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('') def test_index_policy_failed(self): rule_name = "os_compute_api:os-instance-usage-audit-log" self.policy.set_rules({rule_name: "project_id:non_fake"}) exc = self.assertRaises( exception.PolicyNotAuthorized, self.controller.index, self.req) self.assertEqual( "Policy doesn't allow %s to be performed." % rule_name, exc.format_message()) def test_show_policy_failed(self): rule_name = "os_compute_api:os-instance-usage-audit-log" self.policy.set_rules({rule_name: "project_id:non_fake"}) exc = self.assertRaises( exception.PolicyNotAuthorized, self.controller.show, self.req, '2012-07-05 10:00:00') self.assertEqual( "Policy doesn't allow %s to be performed." % rule_name, exc.format_message())

commit_message:
Add a placement audit command

There are different situations when allocations can be orphaned.
Adding a new nova-manage command to lookup at all resource providers
and check against the related compute nodes whether they have
orphaned allocations.

Change-Id: I537ed74503d208957f0a97af3ab754a6750dac20
Closes-Bug: #1793569
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/670112/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os_resource_classes as orc def _delete_orphaned_allocations(self, ctxt, placement, dry_run, compute_nodes): num_processed = 0 faults = 0 # FIXME(sbauza): Should we rather loop over RPs instead of CNs ? # If so, given we don't have pagination for RPs, we need to make sure # asking for *all* RPs wouldn't be a performance issue. for cn in compute_nodes: # Get all the active instances from this compute node # TODO(sbauza): We could prevent another loop by instead using # get_uuids_by_host with some node parameter to this method instances = objects.InstanceList.get_by_host_and_node( ctxt, cn.host, cn.hypervisor_hostname, expected_attrs=[]) inst_uuids = [instance.uuid for instance in instances] # Get all active migrations for this compute node migs = objects.MigrationList.get_in_progress_by_host_and_node( ctxt, cn.host, cn.node) mig_uuids = [migration.uuid for migration in migs] try: # There could be children RPs under the compute node root RP. # FIXME(sbauza): Make this method officially public rps_in_tree = placement._get_providers_in_tree(ctxt, cn.uuid) except exception.ResourceProviderRetrievalFailed: print(_('Not able to find resource providers tree matching ' 'the compute node UUID %s. Please check its ' 'allocations manually.' % cn.uiid)) faults += 1 continue for rp in rps_in_tree: try: pallocs = placement.get_allocations_for_resource_provider( ctxt, rp['uuid']) except exception.ResourceProviderAllocationRetrievalFailed: print(_('Not able to find allocations for resource ' 'provider %s.' % rp['uuid'])) faults += 1 continue for consumer_uuid, consumer_resources in six.iteritems( pallocs.allocations): consumer_allocs = consumer_resources['resources'] if any(rc in NOVA_RCS for rc in consumer_allocs): # This is an allocation for Nova resources # We need to guess whether the instance was deleted # or if the instance is currently migrating if (consumer_uuid not in inst_uuids and consumer_uuid not in mig_uuids): if dry_run: output(_('[dry-run] Delete allocations for ' ' consumer UUID ' '%(consumer)s: %(allocations)s') % {'consumer': consumer_uuid, 'allocations': consumer_allocs}) else: try: placement.delete_allocation_for_instance( ctxt, consumer_uuid) output(_('Deleted allocations for ' ' consumer UUID ' '%(consumer)s: %(allocations)s') % {'consumer': consumer_uuid, 'allocations': consumer_allocs}) except exception.AllocationDeleteFailed: print(_('Not able to delete allocations ' 'for consumer UUID %s' % consumer_uuid)) faults += 1 continue num_processed += 1 return (num_processed, faults) @action_description( _("Deletes orphaned allocations that are no longer corresponding to " "existing instance resources. This command requires that " "the [api_database]/connection and [placement] configuration " "options are set.")) @args('--max_count', metavar='<max_count>', dest='max_count', help='Maximum number of compute nodes to look at allocations. ' 'If you have a large number of instances, consider specifying ' 'a custom value and run the command until it exits with ' '0 or 4.') @args('--dry-run', action='store_true', dest='dry_run', default=False, help='Runs the command and prints output but does not commit any ' 'changes. The return code should be 4.') @args('--verbose', action='store_true', dest='verbose', default=False, help='Provide verbose output during execution.') def audit(self, max_count=None, verbose=False, dry_run=False): """Provides information about orphaned allocations that can be removed Return codes: * 0: Command completed successfully and no orphaned instances existed. * 1: An unexpected error happened during run. * 4: Orphaned instances were detected and deleted. * 127: Invalid input. """ # TODO(sbauza): Are we sure we have all Nova RCs ? NOVA_RCS = [orc.VCPU, orc.MEMORY_MB, orc.DISK_GB, orc.VGPU] ctxt = context.get_admin_context() output = lambda msg: None if verbose: output = lambda msg: print(msg) if max_count is not None: try: max_count = int(max_count) except ValueError: max_count = -1 unlimited = False if max_count < 1: print(_('Must supply a positive integer for --max-count.')) return 127 else: max_count = 50 unlimited = True output(_('Running batches of %i until complete') % max_count) placement = report.SchedulerReportClient() num_processed = 0 faults = 0 # TODO(sbauza): Paginate over a marker that would be persisted # That would prevent checking compute nodes that were already verified marker = None while True: compute_nodes = context.scatter_gather_skip_cell0( ctxt, objects.ComputeNodeList.get_by_pagination, max_count, marker) if compute_nodes: marker = compute_nodes[-1] processed, faults = self._delete_orphaned_allocations( ctxt, placement, dry_run, compute_nodes) num_processed += processed if faults: break else: # We're done with checking all compute nodes break if not unlimited: break if num_processed is not 0: output(_('Processed %s instances.') % num_processed) if faults is not 0: return 1 return 4 return 0

commit_message:
POC: Option to avoid rsync and stream logs instead

This approach should address the concerns regarding rsync being too
slow in some cases and timing out. This newer approach creates a tar
archive which is streamed with minimal compression.

The archive is never stored on disk, so it avoid failures caused by
low-disk space on remote host.

Change-Id: Ibaae2c89ff499f07167dfcb1a1eeefa80542d72b
Related-Bug: #1862612

commit_message:
Doc: Overview of configuration variables in quickstart and CI workflow

Change-Id: Ie229d9b7523d22e104de1f4c88316d4bc12d3ba0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/00/636600/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: From where the playbook takes its variables. -------------------------------------------- By default, ansible playbooks run in CI take variables from all these sources, in revers order of priority (last group takes precedence) - release args - nodes args - featureset - env vars - extra_vars, which includes - featureset override - vxlan_vars - default args - zuul variables release args, extra vars (and featureset overrides), vxlan vars, default args and zuul variables are taken or calculated in tripleo-ci repom env vars use a mixed approach, part is taken from quickstart repo, part is taken from the tripleo-ci repo nodes args and featuresets are taken from tripleo-quickstart repo, but are regulated by vars: clause in zuul variable configuration. I.e. to map a job to a featureseet we pass var: featureset: #number Release vars are produced by the emit_release_script tool in tripleo-ci, based on the type of the job, the tool can produce different releases value and drln hash value to drive the different steps of the run. For example and upgrade job will have different values for the install and upgrade stage Node args are taken from the configuration files in config/nodes, and set the values for the overcloud topology (how many controllers, how many computes, pecific configuration for a topology) featureset is that file that contains the trasnscript of what feature to test during a run. Would it run IPv6 or IPv4 ? Will it enable SSL ? Will it test with a simple ping or tempest ? By design it is the most important file, the idea is that you can undestand what a job is doing precisely by looking at just this file, and it should not be overridden. There are exception, but the general idea is that this file should give you the most important information you need to know on a job env vars are specific for the environment we are running on. This sets or overrides variables that are specific for example to a run that tests multinode in rdo-cloud, which may be different from the ones when running multinode in upstream extra vars are a generic containers for variables that don't fit into other categories. It contains just the overrides to the featureset file right now. vxlan vars (deprecated) were created as a bridge to migrate jobs to zuulv3 that offerex vxlan tunnel functionality by default, and we needed a way to disable gradually our implementation default args are specific to tripleo ci runs, and set extravariable that set paths used by the job. zuul variables are taken directly from the zuul inventory in the executor, dumped into a file and passed as extra vars to quickstart. Only the zuul dictionary in the inventory is passed. I need a particular variable to have a particular value, where should I put it ? -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- First thing is trying to classify your variable. Does is fit in one of the categories above ? If it does you're ok, if it doesn't, you need to find a place for it to fit anyway, so choose the closest. Second thing is trying to find out which value your variable will take for the variants that are not determined by just the combination of classes above. For example a variable could fit a particular featureset, but the same featureset is run on different releases, and may have different values for each. To accomplish this, you may use jinja code in the variable definition, to select the appropriate value depending on some other variables Be aware that you variable must work will all the combinations in which the variable is involved. We have approximately 42 jobs upstream, 85 in rdoproject. .. code-block:: bash cd tripleo-ci/; git grep -h name: | grep -v base | grep triple-ci | wc -l cd rdo-jobs/; git grep -h name: | grep tripleo-ci | wc -l We run in at three diffferent environment: rdocloud, in upstream cloud, in libvirt. And operate with various different topologies: OVB, multinode, standalone, undercloud-only And dealing with 4 releases: master to master-3, sometimes -4 None of these combinations are expliticty classified in the file. FOr example there is no file that contains all the variable in case of a master run. You'll need to make sure you consider all the not so explicit classification when setting a value. We have 187 distinct variables in featuresets only .. code-block:: bash cd config/general_config grep -h -o '^[a-z_A-Z-].*:' *.yml | sort -u | wc -l We have 28 distinct variables in environment files .. code-block:: bash cd config/general_config grep -h -o '^[a-z_A-Z-].*:' *.yml | sort -u | wc -l We have 14 distinct variables in nodes configuration .. code-block:: bash cd config/general_config grep -h -o '^[a-z_A-Z-].*:' *.yml | sort -u | wc -l

commit_message:
add more dns forwarding options to freeipa

The default will be to use auto_forward
use_auto_forward: true

By default no-forwarders is disabled
use_no_forwarder: false

By default if use_auto_forward is false
the following dns servers will be used
as forwarding server destinations.
dns_forwarder_address:
    - 1.1.1.1
    - 1.0.0.1

Users can overr the dns servers
used as the forwarding address.

Change-Id: I4970a7373e3313f67236fa8e14f2a0c82b464489

deleted_lines: # Fail as early as possible if the docker # group is not setup appropriately. # This has to be done AFTER package intalls. # Set up docker groups if ! groups | grep -Eq "docker|dockerroot"; then echo "$USER is not in the docker|dockerroot group." if grep -q docker: /etc/group; then DG=docker elif grep -q dockerroot: /etc/group; then DG=dockerroot elif ! grep -q docker /etc/group; then sudo groupadd docker DG=docker fi sudo usermod -aG $DG $USER echo -e "\e[31m WARNING: The script has exited the current shell in order to setup \ the user groups via usermod correctly. Please re-execute the script. \e[0m" exec sg $DG newgrp `id -gn` fi # This can only be checked after rpms are installed. # Check the Docker config if [[ -f /etc/docker/daemon.json ]]; then if cat /etc/docker/daemon.json | grep '"group": "docker"'; then echo "docker group is already added to /etc/docker/daemon.json" elif cat /etc/docker/daemon.json | grep '"group": "dockerroot"'; then echo "dockerroot group is already added to /etc/docker/daemon.json" elif (( $(cat /etc/docker/daemon.json | wc -m) > 3 )); then echo -e "\e[31m /etc/docker/daemon.json is populated. \ Exit this script and either clear the file or add the docker group. \e[0m" | xargs exit 1 else echo "The docker|dockerroot group will be added to /etc/docker/daemon.json." fi fi # Ensure the docker process has been restarted sudo systemctl restart docker

commit_message:
Add config for cinder mounting needs

This patch adds a config option 'mount_point_base' by which we can
provide the mount point for *fs volumes.
The different types of FS drivers will have separate directory for
mounting their volumes,
Eg: <mount_point_base>/nfs, <mount_point_base>/xyzfs etc.
The default mount point for *fs volumes is /var/lib/glance/mnt/*fs.

Closes-Bug: #1866966

Change-Id: I10b5ea4943ad9388ce1962eae9204b905c8ff24a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance_store refs/changes/00/709300/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CORE_OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('state_path', default='/var/lib/glance', help="Top-level directory for maintaining glance's state"), ] cfg.StrOpt('nfs_mount_base', default='$state_path/mnt', help=""" Directory where the NFS volume is mounted on the glance node. The default is 'mnt' directory of the location where glance's Python module is installed. Possible values: * A string representing absolute path of mount point. """), nfs_mount_base = getattr( self.conf, self.backend_group).nfs_mount_base nfs_mount_base = self.conf.glance_store.nfs_mount_base if connection_info['driver_volume_type'] == 'nfs': connection_info['mount_point_base'] = nfs_mount_base

commit_message:
Added tempest_tempestconf_profile_ specific vars

Added tempest_tempestconf_profile_extras and
tempest_tempestconf_profile_overrides variables

tempest_tempestconf_profile_extras is designed to extend basic
tempest_tempestconf_profile dictionary when required. New var has
presedence in case of having same keys defined. It can be used
to define image or other extra params without need of overriding
defult things

tempest_tempestconf_profile_overrides var is a replacement for
tempest_tempest_conf_overrides which was used in inapropriate way
as tempestconf profile overrides have pretty different format from what
is used by config_template.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-tempestconf/latest/user/profile.html

Related-Bug: #1868938

Change-Id: Ib1e78a6ce2085df82d2a22db6817e800432f2f05
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Dmitriy Rabotyagov (noonedeadpunk) <noonedeadpunk@ya.ru>

commit_message:
Add always tags for hieradata render in external upgrade.

When executing the external-upgrade command, if some of the
external_upgrade_tasks make use of the all_nodes vars (*_short_node_names
for example) then the command fails as these variables weren't
rendered. This only happens when we run the external-upgrade command
passing --tags, as the facts tags are being skipped.

This patch adds the always tags into those tasks which miss it for
external_upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml.

Change-Id: I0913df554b75d25215d5ae6547b939ad0356df3c

commit_message:
Refactored tox jobs

- assure we test triple-jobs-gerrit.py file
- fix division by zero bug with above file
- simplified tox.ini file
- prevent accidental regression on CI by checking number of passed tests
- removed test_molecule.py file which was the precursor of what later
  become pytest-molecule

Change-Id: Id6ffb9df88a376bcd3c8a0d77b2d378fca8da115

commit_message:
DVR: only output packets from gateway directly to VMs

With DVR and the iptables_hybrid firewall driver, all packets from
tunnels are output direcly to VM ports and don't hit the NORMAL flow.
This means the mac addtesses of remote ports are not learned and so
packets in the oppsite direction are always flooded. This patch changes
the transient table so only packets from the gateway are output to VMs.
Other packets will hit the lower prority NORMAL flow. This restores the
behaviour to what it was before https://review.opendev.org/#/c/472691/

Closes-bug: #1866445
Change-Id: I812e1aeb2490cc5b0fd4b3f3f924fd771ba27bfa

commit_message:
HA: drop spurious mysql user on stack deploy

In HA deployments, puppet-mysql is not in charge of deleting
all default users in the DB, so we end up keeping an extra
root@<controller-x> user that is never used nor supported for
password update. Make sure we delete it at creation time.

Change-Id: I0dbe6bd43ad0e6bcb884798912d195e94738c344
Closes-Bug: #1867165
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/26/712726/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
build-containers: optimize log collection

This should avoid unnecessary copy operations for the sole purpose of
log collection by telling rsync to create hardlinks.

Change-Id: I6921d11318b7e7aecf1521b8289e3b7533a77087
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/49/702949/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # rsync with hardlinking, see https://superuser.com/a/1360635/3004 for DIR in /var/log /etc/docker /etc/containers; do mkdir -p {{ workspace }}$DIR/ rsync -var --no-links --link-dest=$DIR $DIR/ {{ workspace }}$DIR/ || true done rsync -var --no-links --include 'yum.repos.d/***' --include 'yum.conf' --include 'dnf/***' --exclude='*' --link-dest=/etc /etc/ {{ workspace }}/etc/ || true
deleted_lines: mkdir -p {{ workspace }}/logs/system mkdir -p {{ workspace }}/etc/docker rsync -var --no-links /var/log/ {{ workspace }}/logs/system/ || true rsync -var --no-links /etc/docker/ {{ workspace }}/etc/docker/ || true rsync -var --no-links /etc/containers/ {{ workspace }}/etc/containers/ || true rsync -var --no-links --include 'yum.repos.d/***' --include 'yum.conf' --include 'dnf/***' --exclude='*' /etc/ {{ workspace }}/etc/ || true

commit_message:
Make all mysql root users managed during stack creation/update

In non-HA deployments (undercloud and standalone) puppet-mysql
handles password for user 'root@localhost' [1], but it doesn't
try to update 'root@%'.
Instantiate the appropriate resource to fix the management of
that mysql user.

Closes-Bug: #1867186

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/server/root_password.pp

Change-Id: I5bb1c23f5fbe7e6fd28537aef4fbfc1be5950dcc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/57/712757/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ($manage_resources) { # the mysql module handles password for user 'root@localhost', but it # doesn't modify 'root@%'. So make sure this user password is managed # as well by creating a resource appropriately. mysql_user { 'root@%': ensure => present, password_hash => mysql_password(hiera('mysql::server::root_password')), } }

commit_message:
Update variable loading pattern from the skeleton

The newer version of the distribution specific variable pattern allows
us to minimize the numeber of configuration files in which we need
to record specific variables by implementing overlay loading.

Also this avoid the previous bug caused by the fact that `RedHat` is
also an ansible_os_family but also an ansible_distribution.

The new pattern explicitely looks for `family-` prefix for families.

This template also adds few empty configuration files which should make
it easier for the developer to identify where he should define the vars.

Change-Id: Ica335be97eacc560bbadf180862d70f55442ae8c

commit_message:
WIP: Make tox work on openstack-ansible-tests

By default tox will not work on on a cloned copy of
apenstack-ansible-tests because all paths inside its commands reffer to
tests/common folder which does not exists.

We fix the issue by creating a symlink that maps tests/common to
repository.

This should allow use to run tox on this repository without affecting
other roles that are using it.

Running commands because tox is possible via tox-run-before, so we
do not to invent new ways of running the tests.

From now on users should be able to just call tox directly as runtests.sh
would be called by tox.

To keep backwards compatibility, running run_tests.sh still works as before.

Change-Id: Id1d4d1f2825d7bec2e1ee52e03110d8797b131e5

commit_message:
Raise hacking to 2.x

We have kept hacking capped below 1.2 for quite awhile. Newer versions
of hacking pull in updated linters that have some good checks.

We want to limit the maximum version of hacking installed since the
global upper constraints does not do this for linters. Otherwise when a
new release of hacking is available in the future, stable branches may
suddenly be broken.

Change-Id: I0e0ee8a169ae93f7efb2cda2b1d2458c1d49e46b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Install proper heatclient for py2 and py3

Currently pip is pulling python-heatclient==2.0.0 on py27
environment which does not work py27 leading to failure in
quickstart.sh install_deps step. Making the version different
for py2 and py3 fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1869161

Change-Id: I9a81d6f555fb0cfdbafffa5f696807df7b29364f
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

subject: Fix os version test
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-29 14:34:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/params.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker/commit/987489a97b5eb083199a432098b8176e7a185d4d', 'message': 'Fix os version test

On RHEL7 we see:
Error: Could not find resource 'Service[pcsd]' for relationship from 'File[etc-pacemaker-authkey]' on node overcloud-controller-2.localdomain

I think a small typo slipped into: 56a11120019d "Update os variables"

 if (versioncmp($::os['release']['major'], '7.0') < 0) {

should be

 if (versioncmp($::os['release']['full'], '7.0') < 0) {

Otherwise the first if is always true and we end up with pcsd_mode =
false which is why we get the error 'Error: Could not find resource
'Service[pcsd]' for relationship from 'File[etc-pacemaker-authkey]'

Tested this and I correctly get past the errors on rhel7.

Change-Id: I7e7f6bc378b3c0f3f3f6e286a09bc8339d3ce70e
Closes-Bug: #1869586
'}]
commit_message:
Fix os version test

On RHEL7 we see:
Error: Could not find resource 'Service[pcsd]' for relationship from 'File[etc-pacemaker-authkey]' on node overcloud-controller-2.localdomain

I think a small typo slipped into: 56a11120019d "Update os variables"

 if (versioncmp($::os['release']['major'], '7.0') < 0) {

should be

 if (versioncmp($::os['release']['full'], '7.0') < 0) {

Otherwise the first if is always true and we end up with pcsd_mode =
false which is why we get the error 'Error: Could not find resource
'Service[pcsd]' for relationship from 'File[etc-pacemaker-authkey]'

Tested this and I correctly get past the errors on rhel7.

Change-Id: I7e7f6bc378b3c0f3f3f6e286a09bc8339d3ce70e
Closes-Bug: #1869586

commit_message:
Cleanup old cruft

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Update requirements: Remove sphinx, it's not needed for testing, add
  pygments which is really needed.
- Update doc/requirements: Remove python 2.7 support
- tox.ini: Remove testing of po files, the infra scripts do this since
  a long time
- Update conf.py, no need to import openstackdocstheme anymore.

Change-Id: I9d030eb450f2c7ae74c25b7564a01b8785503e5e

commit_message:
Add UDP LBs to the basic cookbook

Add a section to the basic cookbook that explains how to setup a UDP
load balancer with UDP-CONNECT health monitor.

And fix typos

Change-Id: Ib67a5c9437e3190f640a953c30f791cb34690910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/32/705232/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Deploy a UDP load balancer with a health monitor ================================================ This is a load balancer solution suitable for UDP-based services. **Scenario description**: * Back-end servers 192.0.2.10 and 192.0.2.11 on subnet *private-subnet* have been configured with an application on UDP port 53. * Subnet *public-subnet* is a shared external subnet created by the cloud operator which is reachable from the internet. * We want to configure a basic load balancer that is accessible from the internet, which distributes requests to the back-end servers. * We want to employ a UDP health check to ensure that the back-end servers are available. UDP health checks may not work correctly if ICMP Destination Unreachable (ICMP type 3) messages are blocked by a security rule (see :ref:`health-monitor-best-practices`). **Solution**: 1. Create load balancer *lb1* on subnet *private-subnet*. 2. Create listener *listener1*. 3. Create pool *pool1* as *listener1*'s default pool. 4. Create a health monitor on *pool1* which connects to the back-end servers. 5. Add members 192.0.2.10 and 192.0.2.11 on *private-subnet* to *pool1*. **CLI commands**: :: openstack loadbalancer create --name lb1 --vip-subnet-id public-subnet # Re-run the following until lb1 shows ACTIVE and ONLINE statuses: openstack loadbalancer show lb1 openstack loadbalancer listener create --name listener1 --protocol UDP --protocol-port 53 lb1 openstack loadbalancer pool create --name pool1 --lb-algorithm ROUND_ROBIN --listener listener1 --protocol UDP openstack loadbalancer healthmonitor create --delay 3 --max-retries 2 --timeout 2 --type UDP-CONNECT pool1 openstack loadbalancer member create --subnet-id private-subnet --address 192.0.2.10 --protocol-port 53 pool1 openstack loadbalancer member create --subnet-id private-subnet --address 192.0.2.11 --protocol-port 53 pool1 .. _health-monitor-best-practices:

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-09-20 01:52:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/609c29218148cc6e5c48669add6e3b5a9ef1e6c5', 'message': 'wip: if wholedisk set boot dev to disk

Change-Id: I6cdbf137c62ae02a7dc3f8d048a290aac48e6103
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-09-22 00:27:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/91158b7e8004b62acc332a0299fe184dc14e7f4e', 'message': 'WIP: if wholedisk set boot dev to disk

Change-Id: I6cdbf137c62ae02a7dc3f8d048a290aac48e6103
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2019-09-23 21:26:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/8d6ee711b51055cf883aa6e6eb4db1532372ef62', 'message': "if wholedisk set boot dev to disk

We changed the default behavior to attempt to walk thorugh and still
setup a network booting environment if we are using a whole disk image
at some point long ago. This was not really a great idea because we are
not actually evaluating the contents of the disk to achieve the desired
end state which is always to boot an instance.

That being said, disks imagle should always have boot loaders, and we
should always thus setup boot from local disk as opposed to set PXE.

NOTE(TheJulia): I'm away and unable to revise this patch. Pleaes feel
free to edit/amend as long as the overall theme is maintained.

Change-Id: I6cdbf137c62ae02a7dc3f8d048a290aac48e6103
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2019-09-24 06:53:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/9635a623f7bd4ce91a1477fa952816a43c3f7956', 'message': "if wholedisk set boot dev to disk

We changed the default behavior to attempt to walk thorugh and still
setup a network booting environment if we are using a whole disk image
at some point long ago. This was not really a great idea because we are
not actually evaluating the contents of the disk to achieve the desired
end state which is always to boot an instance.

That being said, disks imagle should always have boot loaders, and we
should always thus setup boot from local disk as opposed to set PXE.

commit_message:
if wholedisk set boot dev to disk

We changed the default behavior to attempt to walk thorugh and still
setup a network booting environment if we are using a whole disk image
at some point long ago. This was not really a great idea because we are
not actually evaluating the contents of the disk to achieve the desired
end state which is always to boot an instance.

That being said, disks imagle should always have boot loaders, and we
should always thus setup boot from local disk as opposed to set PXE.

*** This change makes sense for something backportable, but
since the default boot mode has been changed in master branch
it may no longer make sense to proceed with.

Change-Id: I6cdbf137c62ae02a7dc3f8d048a290aac48e6103

commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/issues/286
[4] - https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/pull/277

Change-Id: I53f758e7e8870b43b675f4c63d986f07d199c259

commit_message:
Fix GPT partition tables after agent writes contents

Fixes errors that were being raised upon restarting the agent
directly written out software raid images as the raidset is
restarted for device consistency and partition updates later
on in the code path of deployment.

Story: 2007455
Task: 39187
Change-Id: I9abf51eb77b262932e70329af5ce1593106a3171

subject: Expose instance action event details out of the API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-15 00:43:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9101d7b90225c14b551e0b09e4afdc2bfd8b82ed', 'message': 'WIP: Expose instance action event details out of the API

todo: api samples tests, negative unit tests

This adds a new microversion to expose the instance action
event details in the
GET /servers/{server_id}/os-instance-actions/{request_id} API.

With the new microversion the "details" key is always returned
with each event dict but the value may be null because of old
records or events that did not fail.

The details are not constrained by policy like the traceback
field since the details are like a fault message on the server
resource when the server is in ERROR status and the fault
message is likewise not constraint by policy unlike the fault
details which is a traceback like the event traceback field.

Implements blueprint action-event-fault-details

Change-Id: I6fe4dd265b0030ce12f92771b255a3d795f03d01

commit_message:
Expose instance action event details out of the API

This adds a new microversion to expose the instance action
event details in the
GET /servers/{server_id}/os-instance-actions/{request_id} API.

With the new microversion the "details" key is always returned
with each event dict but the value may be null because of old
records or events that did not fail.

The details are not constrained by policy like the traceback
field since the details are like a fault message on the server
resource when the server is in ERROR status and the fault
message is likewise not constraint by policy unlike the fault
details which is a traceback like the event traceback field.

This commit add a SYSTEM_READER ('rule: system_reader_api') role
to the Show Server Action Details API. With this default policy,
events fault details can be displayed. And also add some nova and
non-nova exception functional tests for os-instance-actions API.

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>

Implements blueprint action-event-fault-details
Change-Id: I6fe4dd265b0030ce12f92771b255a3d795f03d01
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/694430/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support allowed_cidrs for Octavia listener

Support ``allowed_cidrs`` property for the resource ``OS::Octavia::Listener``,
the property is allowed to be updated as well. The property 'allowed_cidrs'
was introduced in Octavia since Train release. The default value is empty
list if it is not specified in Heat template.

Task: 38952
Story: 2007378

Change-Id: I9d38716b236b0782f0d09097b7a0f615fe5be041
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/94/711394/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Support ``allowed_cidrs`` property for the resource ``OS::Octavia::Listener``, the property is allowed to be updated as well. The property 'allowed_cidrs' was introduced in Octavia since Train release. The default value is empty list if it is not specified in Heat template.

commit_message:
Retry agent get_command_status upon failures

The agent command status code lacks any retry mechanism
which meant if any intermittent failure such as a dropped
packet or an overloaded firewall could potentially begin
to cause the entire deployment or cleaning process to derail
and fail.

This fix addes logic to ensure we retry upon such failures.

Worth noting, the exact same logic has been used elsewhere
in the agent client code for the exact same problem when
issuing commands.

Change-Id: I4f6581b7fb895ed2b1d505b9947e363665551b57
Story: 2007470
Task: 39158
(cherry picked from commit 242775ae184582ce51a006e5797e7017133617f3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/38/715438/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_commands_status_retries(self): with mock.patch.object(self.client.session, 'get', autospec=True) as mock_get: res = mock.MagicMock(spec_set=['json']) res.json.return_value = {'commands': []} mock_get.side_effect = [ requests.ConnectionError('boom'), res] self.assertEqual([], self.client.get_commands_status(self.node)) self.assertEqual(2, mock_get.call_count)

commit_message:
Exit overcloud-deploy.sh on provision failure

This script file does not have 'set -e' due to the exit handling of
other commands in this script, so provision failures do not stop the
overcloud deploy from happening.

This change will exit this script if provision does not succeed.

Change-Id: I76edf84d206ee1601dccb39c8380f0bdd575173e

commit_message:
Add mordred candidacy for OpenStackSDK for V

Change-Id: Ie18d68192f9a9e7b200d3195b6bd514fd07a0aec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/23/715523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi everybody! I'd like to run for PTL of OpenStackSDK again. We just merged the OpenStackClient and OpenStackSDK teams. While on the one hand this is a nice big new challenge, I think it also presents an excellent opportunity to accelerate our long-standing goal of integrating the two more seamlessly. I'm excited to get some motion on that. In this last cycle we finally got started on the long-awaited python-*client-ectomy from OpenStackClient by removing glanceclient. I'm hoping in the next cycle we can at least remove keystoneclient - but I think we can pick up the pace now. We need to streamline how config and arguments are parsed so that it's 100% consistent between OSC and SDK and Ansible. This is going to mean using openstack.config in OpenStackClient more directly - and I think it's going to mean an end to the double-auth dance. That, in turn, will likely tie in to attempting to unwind the plugin structure from entrypoints and laying in an optimization so that we can skip entrypoints calls in most cases. We've recently been more aggressive with adding new project-specific cores and I'd like to continue that. We need to trust people from project teams to help maintain relevant code in SDK and OSC, and as a result get into the habit of getting support for new things into SDK and OSC as a part of shipping them in the service. That leads to our need to get to the point where both SDK and OpenStackClient can speak to the latest microversion for the projects supporting microversions. This has been mentioned as one of the things people from the projects don't like about OSC vs the project-specific CLIs. The thing is, we will already use the most recent microversion we understand - so we already behave like people want us to. The thing we need to get to is understanding the MV as it's added. The momentum is picking up to get a lot accomplished, and I'd love to keep helping to pushing these rocks uphill. Thanks! Monty

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-26 10:06:28.000000000', 'files': ['candidates/victoria/Winstackers/lpetrut@cloudbasesolutions.com'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/election/commit/3556cf6b166c5c45dca18439780326364ee6bb1c', 'message': 'Add Lucian Petrut candidacy for Winstackers

commit_message:
Add Lucian Petrut candidacy for Winstackers

Change-Id: Id3134abc20979457934964faee90c40a6237b1e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/48/715148/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi, I'd like to announce my candidacy, continuing as Winstackers PTL for the upcoming Victoria cycle. I've been working on OpenStack for quite some time now, focusing on Windows integration. I'm really happy with what we managed to achieve so far, making OpenStack a viable option for Windows deployments and vice versa, making Hyper-V a good KVM alternative, especially for Windows workloads. As with other OpenStack teams, stability has been the main focus over the past few releases and I think we managed to take big steps in that direction, especially when it comes to Microsoft Failover Cluster and S2D support. We also kept in touch with the OpenStack community, conforming to project wide goals (e.g. handling Python 3 deprecation in the early stages), fixing bugs and picking up features in a timely manner. It's no secret that we've been working on Ceph Windows support recently and this will be the main theme for the upcoming cycle. This has been one of the most demanded features. Thank you for your consideration, Lucian Petrut

commit_message:
Add knikolla candidacy for keystone PTL for V

Change-Id: I692ff3551f1a0746addba37e361021c3c50fe41b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/26/715026/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Please consider my candidacy for the role of keystone PTL for the Victoria cycle. I have been involved with keystone and the OpenStack community for 4 years now, wearing the hats of user, operator, and developer. During these years, my focus has mostly been on identity federation and single sign-on. Im deeply grateful to all the people that have mentored me and helped me throughout the years, and I promise that if I am elected PTL I will strive to provide a welcoming environment for all, especially new contributors. My focus will primarily be that of a maintainer and enabler. Ensuring that there are no roadblocks to contributions by making sure the CI is well oiled, our documentation is up to date, that reviews get the attention they need, that releases get done, and that lists end with an oxford comma. The introduction of weekly bug duty during the Ussuri cycle was successful in ensuring new bug reports get triaged and fixed in a timely manned. I will continue that process and fill in the gaps in the weeks that no one else can take that duty. A lot of the work done in the last few cycles was cross-project work such as system scope, more granular default roles, and unified limits. I will continue to monitor the progress of their implementation and consumption in other projects. Disclaimer: I will not be able to devote 100% of my time to working on keystone, however I will have the flexibility to devote the necessary time when something requests it. Thank you, Kristi Nikolla

commit_message:
Adding Mark Goddard candidacy for Kolla Victoria PTL

Change-Id: I76547ce4e64b924885779822816ac536c5c59f73
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/50/715550/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi, I'd like to nominate myself to serve as the Kolla PTL for the Victoria cycle. I have been PTL for the Train and Ussuri cycles, and would like the opportunity to continue to lead the team. I am pleased with the current state of the project. We have an active community, produce interesting and useful features, and regularly receive positive feedback. The Kolla community has always been notable for being vendor-neutral and operator-driven. I recently made a proposal for a Kolla --SIG-- Club [1] with the aim of improving communication between regular contributors and the wider community. We had a good response, and I'm looking forward to seeing how it progresses this cycle. If elected this cycle I'd like to encourage continued work on some familiar themes - improving sustainability, increasing test coverage, and better integrating Kayobe [2]. I'd also like to see us focus on our documentation. Thanks for reading, Mark Goddard (mgoddard) [1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/013122.html [2] https://docs.openstack.org/kayobe

commit_message:
Add gagehugo candidacy for OpenStack-Helm for V

Change-Id: I9e8d6104f12b5bf2ff4be896528325193bbfdb3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/84/715584/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hello everyone, I would like to nominate myself to serve as the OpenStack-Helm PTL for the Victoria cycle. I have been a contributor to OpenStack-Helm for roughly 3 years now, primarily focused on using the various charts to deploy and operate an OpenStack environment on top of Kubernetes. I've also been involved with the maintenance and development of a few of the charts, primarily the keystone chart and the overall policy settings of the other charts. One goal I would like to accomplish in this cycle is the adoption of the Loci project underneath the OpenStack-Helm umbrella. OpenStack-Helm utilizes Loci heavily for its image building and deploying, and with the current downturn of activity in the Loci project, we could bring the project in and provide the time and resources to keep it moving forward into the future. We need to continue maintaining our checks and gating as well. These have been a pain-point in the past and we have had several excellent individuals step up and help fix issues when needed. I would like to continue focusing our work effort on them to make sure both our testing and gating is rock solid. I believe together we can continue to do amazing work here. - Gage

commit_message:
Added missing {user, project}_domain_name in Api

In examples/connect.py, openstack.connect api call requires
user_domain_name and project_domain_name as a required args
which was missing lead to api failure while connecting to
openstack cloud.

It fixes the same.

Story: 2006281
Task: 35984

Change-Id: I79d977282f4bc7699957a0275d251b75c2642cc2
Signed-off-by: Amol Kahat <amolkahat@gmail.com>

subject: fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-28 21:59:06.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-kubernetes-minion.sh', 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-kubernetes-master.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/0feb2b185179a20aa97021d64263c96e697901a3', 'message': 'fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

Kubelet fails to handle SELinux labelling of Cinder PV without
presenting the rootfs to Kubelet and as a result, an unprivileged
container lacks the ability to access the path.

With this patch, Kubelet handles the correct labelling automatically
when a Cinder PV is attached to a pod.

The default behaviour using system containers in Fedora Atomic is to
mount rootfs [1] but we did not implement the same behaviour in Fedora
CoreOS which was a mistake as this was a missing piece of code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/dockerfiles/kubernetes-kubelet/config.json.template#L335

Story: 2007413
Task: 39129

Change-Id: Id59c604928244bf49773b7519fa756d5b2814b69
(cherry picked from commit 1994e9448a4d131e6305b68e49f1fdcdb5420cef)
'}]
commit_message:
fcos: Mount /:/rootfs:ro to Kubelet

Kubelet fails to handle SELinux labelling of Cinder PV without
presenting the rootfs to Kubelet and as a result, an unprivileged
container lacks the ability to access the path.

With this patch, Kubelet handles the correct labelling automatically
when a Cinder PV is attached to a pod.

The default behaviour using system containers in Fedora Atomic is to
mount rootfs [1] but we did not implement the same behaviour in Fedora
CoreOS which was a mistake as this was a missing piece of code.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/dockerfiles/kubernetes-kubelet/config.json.template#L335

Story: 2007413
Task: 39129

Change-Id: Id59c604928244bf49773b7519fa756d5b2814b69
(cherry picked from commit 1994e9448a4d131e6305b68e49f1fdcdb5420cef)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/61/715661/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[ceph-daemons] Redirect all the logs to stdout

This is to redirect all the logs from daemons to stdout to avoid
accumulating large sized log files on filesystem.

NOTE: The ceph-osd daemon won't work this way and is addressed
separately in https://review.opendev.org/715295. All other Ceph
daemons are included here.

Change-Id: I3045d6e941791aba14979472fac1bca09776d3bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/16/715716/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ceph-OSD: Add log tailer to ceph-osd

This change adds in a log tailer script in a pod that tails the ceph
logs, periodicly truncating them.

Change-Id: Idbe03d4123f86b1b88e277fea6d13f58104f94b0
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/95/715295/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: log-runner {{ tuple $envAll "ceph_osd" | include "helm-toolkit.snippets.image" | indent 10 }} command: tail -f /var/log/ceph/* readinessProbe: exec: command: - truncate initialDelaySeconds: 60 periodSeconds: 60 volumeMounts: - name: pod-var-log mountPath: /var/log/ceph readOnly: false

commit_message:
If only .pyc exist, the extension API will be disabled

In some commercial production environments, generally will not expose the
source code, this means that only .pyc files exist in the environment.In
this case, the extension API cannot be loaded.

Closes-Bug:#1869148
Change-Id: Id5238e7efe5ff0b80197ac0afa9f5f7a73239f20
(cherry picked from commit 8c582d87912270afa37371bbb202ae98dc1d375c)
(cherry picked from commit 6b3daf4814cac704a4a112a559f3e36121a0e532)

commit_message:
Add unit test for rackspace block-storage workaround

The previous patch added a workaround for block-storage on
rackspace. Add a unit test for the project_id logic.

Change-Id: I466bb7fa3ac4c627e34ee36fe6a417079bdb0a3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/58/715058/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_rackspace_workaround(self): # We're skipping loader here, so we have to expand relevant # parts from the rackspace profile. The thing we're testing # is that the project_id logic works. cc = cloud_region.CloudRegion("test1", "DFW", { 'profile': 'rackspace', 'region_name': 'DFW', 'auth': {'project_id': '123456'}, 'block_storage_endpoint_override': 'https://example.com/v2/', }) self.assertEqual( 'https://example.com/v2/123456', cc.get_endpoint('block-storage') ) def test_rackspace_workaround_only_rax(self): cc = cloud_region.CloudRegion("test1", "DFW", { 'region_name': 'DFW', 'auth': {'project_id': '123456'}, 'block_storage_endpoint_override': 'https://example.com/v2/', }) self.assertEqual( 'https://example.com/v2/', cc.get_endpoint('block-storage') )

commit_message:
Change default listening address for health checks.

Currently, regardless of the version of the IP protocol used, health
check services for kuryr CNI and kuryr controller, are always listen on
0.0.0.0, which effectively means any interface. In this patch we propose
to chang that to include IPv6 address as well.

Change-Id: I96fc1033b93bd54b70c7caaa428076baf73b4207

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Only update required is in tox to define common baspython as py3 os that
all tox env including [testenv:functional] will use py3 instead of py2.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Iaa968bccc27575ab81b05066cfb8d34817cdf249

commit_message:
Allow setting volume attach status

This feature was available in the Cinder client however it does
not exist in OpenStack client.

This patch adds the ability to use `--attach-status` to reset the
attach status of a volume using the Cinder API.

Change-Id: I2631e326a0e693deccfc95df149115442765bf3d
Closes-Bug: #1745699

commit_message:
os-traits: release 2.3.0

Release os-traits 2.3.0 to pick up following fixes:
  - Switch to hacking 2.x [1]
  - Remove use of six [2]
  - setup.cfg: Remove unused 'build_sphinx' configuration [3]
  - setup.cfg: Configure 'python-requires' [4]

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I510fbc4ee923cee005826cf81220f9e6e0549c9d

commit_message:
[tests] Improve devstack/post playbook efficiency

By adjusting the syntax to the newer format, the fetch-subunit
role will be skipped entirely, rather than run with all its
tasks skipped. This gives us results sooner and burns less
electricity, making the world a better place. :)

commit_message:
Run fetch-subunit-output role conditionally

Jobs that inherit from base job don't always run unit tests or
use subunit. This post playbook will fail for them, so make subinit
role optional and set by default for true.
For example disable it for ansible collection functional jobs:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711471/
Change-Id: I50b1020c896d7d8a7d58e62de778bb8c2b6e970e
(cherry picked from commit 994c97e0bfbc1ac693e54ff14d4121f68c620b0d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/70/714770/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added new project openstack-tempest-skiplist

It creates the openstack-tempest-skiplist and import existing
skiplist from openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras project to
openstack-tempest-skiplist.

It is a collection of skipped tempest tests which is initially
started by TripleO team and will be shared with OSA and other
projects.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/714030

Change-Id: Id9648164023590a440c56906ecd982523b176179
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] ceph-mon: Add log tailer to ceph-mon

This change adds in a log tailer script in a pod that tails the ceph
logs, periodicly truncating them.

Change-Id: I7237f68681f52220b6e1889ff98e2a278de15661

commit_message:
Remove mysql dependency

The module does only rely on the mysql
module implictly through the openstacklib
module which means its not a direct dependency.

This value is always outdated since we bumped
the dependency in [1]. This probably needs to
be fixed in other modules as well.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710523/

Change-Id: Ic6d4794e7960059d70534c1cbcc12f4e933ad1a4

commit_message:
Add support for node reconfigure

This spec proposes to allow Ironic users to perform reconfiguration
of an active node.

Change-Id: I6ddc02fdfb9b9d7e020fe9f724df56a18dd294ba
Story: 2005129
Task: 29803

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-23 11:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/glance/templates/glance-api.conf.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/4deabcdaddcbef5b39d0bc5fcd0c5b919c64e8dc', 'message': "Add show_image_direct_url when glance_backend_ceph is true

When use ceph as the backend storage of glance, the
'show_image_direct_url' must be set to True when
would like to use copy-on-write in the ceph offical
documents

Change-Id: Ide644ebc1917b8f9931e48c77c7808ba62a36d7c
"}]
commit_message:
Add show_image_direct_url when glance_backend_ceph is true

When use ceph as the backend storage of glance, the
'show_image_direct_url' must be set to True when
would like to use copy-on-write in the ceph offical
documents

Change-Id: Ide644ebc1917b8f9931e48c77c7808ba62a36d7c

'}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2019-06-24 20:30:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/commit/b8f4b705312cdd5f4fb7603072006be69354f3e1', 'message': "[WIP] Move to 'OnDelete' upgrade strategy for ceph-osd daemonsets

- This is to move upgrade strategy for ceph-osd ds to 'OnDelete'

- Check for backfill/recover between  osd restarts so that performance of
  the ceph cluster will not be degraded .

- Helm post upgrade  hook to trigger an orchestrator which will delete the
  osd pods intelligently by considering pg backfill/recover status.

- Reliable ceph-osd upgrades since we are checking ceph cluster between pod
  restarts.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Taylor <st053q@att.com>

Change-Id: I21e1bd6796991b26f2f8eefe608d0cefd2356e60

commit_message:
[wip]Ceph-OSD: Move to 'OnDelete' upgrade strategy for ceph-osd daemonsets

- Move upgrade strategy for ceph-osd ds to 'OnDelete'

- Helm post upgrade  hook to trigger an orchestrator which will delete the
  osd pods intelligently by considering pg  status.

- Reliable ceph-osd upgrades since we are checking for pg status before picking
  osd for restarts.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Taylor <st053q@att.com>

Change-Id: I21e1bd6796991b26f2f8eefe608d0cefd2356e60

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Create rack based daemonset and configmap

This is to extend the host override functionaity to create rack based
daemonset along with list of nodes belongs to that rack sothat single
ds will spawn the pods on rack.

This will be helpful when we enable rack based failure domians since
upgrades will first bring down the pods belongs to respective racks.

Change-Id: I92f37fa169322894185325e69153dc20da1b17a1

subject: RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-20 15:36:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/264469c2b7e6070edef278279097390d9c6e5e17', 'message': 'RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-03-27 14:39:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/1c09584a361abeb2adc3cda7e214d9fc9fa4c147', 'message': 'RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and

cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a

(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)

commit_message:
RBD: fix volume reference handling in clone logic

This patch fixes a bug in volume cloning where the source volume is
prematurely closed.  If the destination volume requires flattening and
an exception occurs during flattening, the code attempts to perform
cleanup operations on an already closed volume.  This resulted in a
segmentation fault which causes cinder to restart.

Co-authored-by: Jon Bernard <jobernar@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib713aa91b775d8ec07ffdb24dfe1db1b6ecf2921
Closes-Bug: #1794956
(cherry picked from commit 394fbd7e20dbd8fb8cc58510657753432c43fa9b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/51/714151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cap Pygments for python 2.7

The last Pygments release to support python 2 is 2.5.2, so our
python 2 tests are failing running the latest version 2.6.1.
